item.title: Ukraine Security Assistance and Oversight Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2024

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 216.

item.title: Department of Homeland Security Appropriations Act, 2024

latestAction.text: The Clerk was authorized to correct section numbers, punctuation, and cross references, and to make other necessary technical and conforming corrections in the engrossment of H.R. 4367.
Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 226.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 217 - 211 (Roll no. 457). (text: CR H4791)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 217 - 211 (Roll no. 457). (text: CR H4791)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 214 - 210 (Roll no. 456).
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 730.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H4791-4799)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 39.

The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 5692, under a closed rule. The resolution provides for 30 minutes of general debate on the bill H.R. 5692 and one motion to recommit. The resolution provides that further consideration of H.R. 4365, the further amendments specified in section 3 shall be considered as adopted and the resolution provides for further consideration of H.R. 4367, the further amendment specified in section 5 shall be considered as adopted.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 118-228, by Mr. Cole.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 118-228, by Mr. Cole.

cdata.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5692) making supplemental appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes; providing for further consideration of the bill (H.R. 4365) making appropriations for the Department of Defense for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes; and providing for further consideration of the bill (H.R. 4367) making appropriations for the Department of Homeland Security for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024.

This resolution sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5692) making supplemental appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes; providing for further consideration of the bill (H.R. 4365) making appropriations for the Department of Defense for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes; and providing for further consideration of the bill (H.R. 4367) making appropriations for the Department of Homeland Security for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
